newsitem.title: JAPAN: Mitsubishi Oil seeks early retirement volunteers.
newsitem.headline: Mitsubishi Oil seeks early retirement volunteers.

text.p: Mitsubishi Oil Co Ltd said on Wednesday it had started seeking volunteers aged over 55 to take early retirement as part of an effort to cut costs.
Last year, Mitsubishi Oil announced plans to cut its work force by about 500 to a total of 3,000 by 2002.
The oil refiner and distributor now aims to reach the target by 2000, a company spokesman said.
In September, Mitsubishi Oil revised its current profit forecast for the year ending March 1997 downward to eight billion yen from an earlier forecast of 20 billion yen.
Current profits in the business year ended March 1996 were 20.73 billion yen.
Japanese oil firms' profits have been plunging as they have not been able to fully pass on higher costs stemming from rising global crude prices and the weaker yen to the wholesale price.
